result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alan Florian Means

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Alan Florian Means not in court, in custody.  Attorney Theodore O'Reilly in court for Alan Florian Means on behalf of Attorney Haley E Wentz.  Attorney Jon Josephsen in court for State of Wisconsin on behalf of Attorney Abby Rockendorf.

Case in court for a status conference.  Defense informs that Mr. Means has additional pending matters in front of Judge Shelton, Branch 40.  Court previously authorized transfer of this case to Branch 40.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing in Branch 40, Rm 634 CH.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 20, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Alan Florian Means not in court, in custody.  Attorney Haley E Wentz appeared by video for Alan Florian Means.  Defendant's appearance waived.  Attorney Abby Rockendorf in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for scheduling conference. Defendant has two other cases; 22CF2052 and 20CF167. Defense received discovery and offer; case to transfer to Branch 40 if global resolution. Defense requested status conference date. Court granted defense's request. Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 16; VIA ZOOM. Status conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Alan Florian Means appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Haley E Wentz appeared by video for Alan Florian Means.  Abby Rockendorf in court, appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded. Court took Judicial Notice to case 20CF167 and Racine Co. Case 21CF879. Sworn for the State: MPD E. Domine.    State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel

Defendant Alan Florian Means not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. OSPD APPOINTMENT OF COUNSEL REPORT

Defendant Alan Florian Means not in court, defendant in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for preliminary hearing. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. State requests that this matter be set in the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing or in the alternative that it be set for status; denied. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  No possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription.
  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Alan Florian Means in court with attorney Theodore OReilly.  Defendant Alan Florian Means in custody.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
